oai_dc:dc.dc:title: William A. Eichbaum Sketchbook, cover, circa 1859
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The front cover from a mounted and bound volume of twenty-five pen-and-ink wash drawings, and two pen-and-ink maps of Nashville created by William A. Eichbaum during the 1850s. Drawings consist of prominent buildings in Downtown Nashville at the time. Eichbaum was a Nashville bookseller and resident for fifty years. He died in 1873. Forms part of the William A. Eichbaum Sketchbook. 1 sketchbook : col. ; 5.75 x 9 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Eichbaum, William A., 1787-1873--Notebooks, sketchbooks, etc.
